job_title: Human Resources Associate in Dallas, TX
pros: The Family Place offers excellent work-life balance and a strong focus on diversity inclusion. Upper management show consistent appreciation for hard work and value the unique perspective and skillset employees bring to the table. As a young professional, my direct supervisor is not only a wonderful mentor, but is dedicated to furthering my continuing education and professional growth within the agency.
cons: Working in-office during the COVID-19 pandemic was unnerving in the beginning. Luckily, the agency actively advocates for its employees and implemented, and maintained, strict policies and procedures to ensure the health and safety of all staff and clients.

job_title: Preschool Assistant Teacher in Dallas, TX
pros: It’s extremely easy work. Working with kids is absolutely amazing, and days go by fairly quickly.
cons: Some people are rude, but there are people like that in every work place.

pros: I liked this job before the pandemic. In the counseling department, we had the autonomy to make decisions about how to run the program in the best way for our clients.
cons: At the beginning of the pandemic, it became very clear that all the upper management cares about is the numbers. With services to clients, they only care about quantity and not quality. Very frustrating and disappointing

pros: Only slightly better than being unemployed…maybe.
cons:
Employees are considered expendable. Executive leadership cares only about employees as much as it directly impacts them. Poor work/life balance (read: they will work you to death). Minimal to no appreciation shown. The pay is also pretty bad. Lots of shady stuff happens when it comes time for inspections and oversight. TFP mismanages programs and funding, then quickly makes things appear on-the-level when people are watching.

With so many jobs available in so many nonprofits and DV agencies, stay away from this place. You’ll probably be happier elsewhere.

cons: None at all this is a wonderful place

review_title: Major Gifts Officer at The Family Place
job_title: Major Gifts Officer in Dallas, TX
pros: Great organization and mission. Committed staff.
cons: I can't think of many cons. Lots of bureaucracy.

pros: I love the mission and purpose of the company.
cons: There’s no cons that I can think of.

pros: Great people, great management, really top tier place to work with
cons: I had no issues during my time working there

review_title: Lukewarm experience, change is definitely needed
pros: Great pay compared to other DV or similar agencies. So so benefits, but good options to choose from. I love my specific job working with clients so I gave a 3 star rating.
cons: Senior leadership has zero respect for lower level staff. There is a terrible attitude of get with the program or you can leave. Decisions are made without consultation to the front line staff, leaving many feeling unappreciated. Self care is not seen as important (it is talked about, but not encouraged by management through policies), and the agency is not trauma informed. Communication between management and front line employees is lacking. I don’t blame the CEO, she has an amazing heart for the work, but her experience seems to be more development based. A change in the Chief of programs is what is needed- many of the decisions come from her and the sentiment is that she is out of touch with what it’s like working with client in the ground floor. Many of the statements made by her are very power and control based, lots of threats and coercion, which is interesting since we are an agency that is supposed to recognize these things and work to end them....

pros: The culture! One of the first things I noticed was the longevity of many employees. This speaks volumes to a new employee on the culture of an organization and the length of time a person wants to be connected to the mission. Next, I noticed the passion and professionalism by all staff. The Family Place truly places clients first (it is on the top of the organizational chart). The New Employee Orientation is well organized, thorough and provides a framework for how your role is connected to the larger mission. They have the onboarding process down! Plus, they value continuing education for all staff levels through an online learning system. It has been a pleasure to be part of the Family Place team and one of the best places I have ever worked.
cons: With so many opportunities for growth and continuing education, I have not experienced cons at TFP.

review_title: Power and control at it's worst!
pros: I had a flexible schedule, which was great for me at the time. I also was supported by my supervisor and the people in my immediate team.
cons: Different programs were given different levels of respect and directors in some departments felt they were able to tell our director what to do and how to run her program (even though they were at the same level). There was also a lot of bullying and issues with power and control, which was facinating given that these are the very issues this company seeks to eliminate!

job_title: Human Resources Associate in Dallas, TX
pros: I've been at many agencies in the domestic violence field and it's sadly so common to run your staff into the ground while trying to rise up to meet the demands of this ever growing population. The Family Place has been incredibly responsive to creating a space where you can go home and unplug from work, something that helps to keep staff around much longer. I also really appreciate the ongoing training and internal training software which helps to create an atmosphere of continual growth.
cons: There is opportunity for growth in continuing to create more relevant and timely trainings on what is going on in the domestic violence field more broadly.

pros: I love working at The Family Place. I enjoy working for my clinical director and her supervisor.  They truly care for our clients and their wellbeing. Wendy trusts my clinical judgment and provides knowledgeable support about DV and trauma. Paige, the CEO is very passionate and incredibly involved with the company.
cons: The stories you hear is pretty intense. Sometimes theres not enough breathing and decompressing after a session. I wish there was a quiet room for staff only to re-center after sessions.

review_title: Lots of Opportunities at a Place with a great Mission
pros: Great working condition and mission. Loved working with lots of different people, and honest staff who care about the clients. If you are accountable and work hard you will be noticed. Management are open to new ideas and always puts their clients first.  CEO truly cares about the employees and the clients.
cons: sometimes felt siloed because there are so many locations and departments

pros: I’ve never felt like I belonged somewhere until I got here. My program director and assistant program always have my back and are always asking for my input which really makes me feel like I’m a part of the motto and not just someone keeping a chair warm. Everyone in the higher ups are easy to reach and have a great open door policy. I’m excited to see what more growing with this agency will bring me.
cons: Thus far have yet to find any cons

pros:
Pay was decent for someone with little experience. 
Decent benefits.
Several Training Opportunities
cons: Upper Management did not care about the well-being of their employees. They often talked about self-care but therapist were made to see too many clients a week.

review_title: Loved the mission and coworkers. Hated the attitude that emanated from the top execs.
pros: There are many people who really care about serving the women, children and men who are victims of domestic violence. These people are a joy to know and a joy to work with.
cons: There is little to no appreciation for a job well done and for going far beyond expectations. There is only criticism without ever asking questions about the situation.

pros: Very open to listening to your ideas and thoughts. Give you a lot of responsibility, not just getting coffee.
cons: Sometimes projects will be given to you without your manager being aware, and so they don't realize how much you are actually doing and why you are having a hard time meeting deadlines.

pros: Being able to use your skills and abilities for a truly worthy cause; Clients are treated with dignity and respect;  You can really believe in what you are doing.
cons: More emphasis is given to the mission than is given to employee satisfaction.  For people who are mission-driven, this is a great place to work.

review_title: Under performing Employees do nothing, High Performing Employees do Everything
pros: Some coworkers are nice and enjoyable to work with. Job hours are set and work isn't taken home.
cons: Low pay, high case load, most employees don't know what they're doing. They hire people who know the job 40% and half attempt to train them. Upper Management, which is where I held my position, was horrible. Terrible communication. CEO and CPO extremely controlling and defensive. They talk about being inclusive and hearing your perspective and force you to do what they want in the end,

pros: A place for the kids to go while their parents are in group meetings.  Opportunities for the children to bond with others from the same unfortunate situations.  Able to work with kids and show them a different view.
cons: Not enough funds to support the program.

pros: Working with Clients and coworkers who are focused on helping Clients. Generous PTO and sick time.
cons: Terrible upper management! Things are constantly changing with little to no time to adjust while upper management make statements of "get on the train or get left behind". Little to no input from the employees on the frontline - Counselor, Case Managers, and Shelter Staff.

review_title: Bad culture, poor management, below average pay. Would not recommend to anyone.
pros: Own workspace and opportunities to learn.
cons: The culture is horrible from the top to the bottom. Leadership does whatever they want without consultation of any staff. The pay is below average. I am very glad to not be there any more. I worked twice as much as they projected in my interview. Horrible work life balance when I’m trying to take care of my family.

review_title: Only work here if you're desperate
pros:
You may receive an office.
There are good opportunities to do training.
cons:
Management is controlling and changes things every 3 months.
There is no room for growth and no room in the budget for salary increases.
The culture is very negative and gossip is commonplace. 
Compensation was below average.
Turnover rate/Burnout Rate was high.
Upper Management needs to figure things out.
